trans-unit.source: Import animations
trans-unit.target: Import animations

trans-unit.source: Beginner Designer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Designer

trans-unit.source: To animate a model, you need to use three kinds of assets together:
trans-unit.target: To animate a model, you need to use three kinds of assets together:

trans-unit.source: models
trans-unit.target: models

trans-unit.source: skeletons
trans-unit.target: skeletons

trans-unit.source: animations
trans-unit.target: animations

trans-unit.source: You can import these assets from 3D model files. Stride supports the following model file types: .3ds, .blend, .dae, .dxf, .fbx, .md2, .md3, .obj, .x
trans-unit.target: You can import these assets from 3D model files. Stride supports the following model file types: .3ds, .blend, .dae, .dxf, .fbx, .md2, .md3, .obj, .x

trans-unit.source: Import a model, skeleton, or animation from a model file
trans-unit.target: Import a model, skeleton, or animation from a model file

trans-unit.source: Drag the model file from Explorer to the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default).
trans-unit.target: Drag the model file from Explorer to the Asset View (in the bottom pane by default).

trans-unit.source: Choose asset type
trans-unit.target: Choose asset type

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, in the Asset View:
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, in the Asset View:

trans-unit.source: 1a. Click Add asset and select Import directly from files.
trans-unit.target: 1a. Click Add asset and select Import directly from files.

trans-unit.source: Choose asset type
trans-unit.target: Choose asset type

trans-unit.source: 2b. Browse to the file and click Open.
trans-unit.target: 2b. Browse to the file and click Open.

trans-unit.source: Specify whether you want to import the 3D model, animation, or skeleton from the model file.
trans-unit.target: Specify whether you want to import the 3D model, animation, or skeleton from the model file.

trans-unit.source: Choose asset type
trans-unit.target: Choose asset type

trans-unit.source: If you choose 3D model, Stride can import any additional materials, textures and skeletons it finds in the model file. You can also import the skeleton from the model (Import new skeleton), import no skeleton (Don't use skeleton), or specify a different skeleton (Use existing skeleton) in the lower field.
trans-unit.target: If you choose 3D model, Stride can import any additional materials, textures and skeletons it finds in the model file. You can also import the skeleton from the model (Import new skeleton), import no skeleton (Don't use skeleton), or specify a different skeleton (Use existing skeleton) in the lower field.

trans-unit.source: Choose asset type
trans-unit.target: Choose asset type

trans-unit.source: If you choose Skeleton, Stride imports only the skeleton from the model file. You might want to do this, for example, if you want to use it for a new skeleton that uses a subset of its nodes.
trans-unit.target: If you choose Skeleton, Stride imports only the skeleton from the model file. You might want to do this, for example, if you want to use it for a new skeleton that uses a subset of its nodes.

trans-unit.source: If you choose Animation, Stride imports only the animation from the model file. This is sufficient for regular animations; for additive information, there are some extra steps. For details, see Additive animation.
trans-unit.target: If you choose Animation, Stride imports only the animation from the model file. This is sufficient for regular animations; for additive information, there are some extra steps. For details, see Additive animation.

trans-unit.source: After you import the assets, Game Studio adds them to the Asset View.
trans-unit.target: After you import the assets, Game Studio adds them to the Asset View.

trans-unit.source: Assets in Asset View
trans-unit.target: Assets in Asset View

trans-unit.source: You can view and edit their properties in the Property Grid (on the right by default). For more information, see Animation properties.
trans-unit.target: You can view and edit their properties in the Property Grid (on the right by default). For more information, see Animation properties.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Use an animation asset
trans-unit.target: Use an animation asset

trans-unit.source: To use an animation asset, add an AnimationComponent to an entity, then add the animation asset to the animation component. For more information, see Set up animations.
trans-unit.target: To use an animation asset, add an AnimationComponent to an entity, then add the animation asset to the animation component. For more information, see Set up animations.

trans-unit.source: !Note Make sure you correctly skin your mesh to the skeleton. If you don't, you won't be able to animate your model correctly.
trans-unit.target: !Note Make sure you correctly skin your mesh to the skeleton. If you don't, you won't be able to animate your model correctly.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also
